applicability_reasoning: This regulation applies to the document for several reasons: 1) The document is from AIB life, which is a regulated entity by the Central Bank of Ireland (as stated in the footer). 2) The document explicitly includes a section (Section 6 - Contacting Us) that provides information about digital platform access through the AIB Mobile Banking app. 3) The document specifically outlines how customers can access services and get assistance through digital means, including viewing documents and updating details through the mobile app. 4) The document provides multiple contact methods (email, phone, postal address) for obtaining assistance. Since the document describes services accessible through a digital platform (AIB Mobile Banking app) and includes contact information for assistance, it falls directly under the scope of Regulation 41 which requires regulated entities to provide information about how to obtain assistance when using digital platforms. The document appears to be complying with this regulation by including the required contact and assistance information.
regulation_title: Information to be provided on available assistance when using digital platforms
regulation_text: 41. (1) Where a regulated entity is engaging with a consumer by means of a digital platform, for the purposes of providing the consumer with a financial service, the regulated entity shall give information to consumers, on the digital platform, on where and how as sistance may be obtained with the following: (a) a specific query with regard to use of the digital platform for the purposes of being provided with such financial services; (b) further information on the financial service provided. (2) The information referred to in paragraph (1) and any associated contact details shall be displayed prominently on the digital platform at all times.
